long_title: Combination of Artificial Intelligence (ENDOAID) and Mucosal Exposure Device (ENDOCUFF) to Enhance Colorectal Neoplasia Detection: a Randomized Controlled Trial
prior_treatment_requirements: 2. They require elective colonoscopy for colorectal cancer screening, polyp surveillance, or investigation of symptoms such as anemia or altered bowel habit;
Exclude - 1. Contraindication to colonoscopy (e.g. intestinal obstruction or perforation)
Exclude - 2. Contraindication or conditions precluding polyp resection (e.g. active gastrointestinal bleeding, uninterrupted anticoagulation or dual antiplatelets)
Exclude - 3. Staged procedure for polypectomy or biopsy of known unresected lesions
Exclude - 4. Previous surgical resection of colon
Exclude - 5. Personal history of colorectal cancer
Exclude - 6. Personal history of familial polyposis syndrome
Exclude - 7. Personal history of inflammatory bowel disease
Exclude - 8. Advanced comorbid conditions (defined as American Society of Anesthesiologists grade 4 or above)
Exclude - 10. Unable to obtain informed consent
short_title: Combination of Artificial Intelligence and Mucosal Exposure Device to Enhance Colorectal Neoplasia Detection
summary: The investigators hypothesize that the combined use of CADe system (ENDOAID) and mucosal exposure device (Endocuff Vision®) would improve the adenoma detection rate when compared to CADe system alone.

arm.arm_description: CADe system will be used during withdrawal phase of colonoscopy.
CADe system and mucosal exposure device (ENDOCUFF) will be used during withdrawal phase of colonoscopy.
